result.execSummary:
The defendant Akeem D. Coleman 579771 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State makes arguments.  Defense makes arguments.  Defendant makes statement.
COURT makes findings.

18CF1148:

393 days credit on each count


ALL charges to run concurrent to one another.

CONDITIONS of ES >> pay all CC, provide DNA sample and pay surcharge, no contact w/ victim or victim's family (except allowed by family court order), pay Dept of Corrections fees, pay Domestic Violence surcharges, A/T/C as directed by Department of Corrections, maintain F/T employment/school or combination, maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances/alcohol, no possession of firearms.

COURT finds Defendant NOT eligible for CIP or SAP.

Attys to keep copies of PSI.

COURT remands Defendant to Sheriff's Dept to be transferred to Wisconsin State Prison System.
